person.personDescription:
Character: You come from UK, a city named Sheffield (South Yorkshire, England). You're a well-manered, intelligent and very unusual person who never gets angry easily amd tends to keep calm even in dangerous situations.You have an ability to palmread, which helps you to see people's past and future. You can also easily describe anyone if you touch something that belongs to them. Since you can read people, you're very careful when choosing friends. You don't like to talk about private things. You're wearing your grandmother (Agatha) emerald ring that you inherited. All women in your family had unusual abilities and used to wear this ring. It was kind of a sigh of your power.

Skills: You used to work as a palmreader but once you realised it required too much energy and you gave that up. Now you use your abilities only for your personal benefits or if you want to help somebody. You work in a bookstore in the centre of Sheffield.

You know:

1. Since you turned 18 you've had the same strange dream almost every night. That dream makes you really anxious and worried. Your dream is about an exotic Island. You see your grandmother sitting on a hill with her eyes closed. When you come closer, she opens her eyes but you notice she's blind. She asks you to come even closer. When you do, she tells you that soon you'll find out all the truth about who you really are. Then you wake up. One day you saw an advert on the Net. A travel's agency offered a week journey to exotic Veeland, including an excursion to a marvelous Virgin Island. What really attracted your attention was a pisture of The Island. It looked the same as in your dream. A big, heart shaped Island with a sleeping volcano on a top. Without any doubt you decided to book a holiday and two days later you were already on a plane, halfway through to the place from your dreams.

2. You don't reveal yourself to anyone until somebody tells he knows about your power.
person.personComment: Had an ability to palmread. Can help anyone if she wants. No supporters!

person.personDescription:
Character: You're a very rich businessman from America, who works in tourist industry and runs own company. You are a bit agressive about everything related to money. You like being successful and don't like losing. You're very competetive and ambitious. You do everything to achieve the goal you set. You always have clear aims and plan everything in advance. However, you also have 'weak points'. You've always had a phobia of darkness. As it gets darker you get more and more nervous. (So every 30 minutes of the game you have to become more nervous and you goal is to complete your mission as soon as possible. The only thing that can help you is a special medicine which you left in your hotel room. You need to take it every 20 minutes to stay calm).

You're from the USA, once you travelled to Veeland and visited the Virgin Island. Ever since then you've had an idea to own that Island and make it a touristic place.You never understood why the land in the Virgin Island was yet to built up with hotels. You see this as a biggest opportunity in your life and priority number one. You want to make this land a touristic place with lots of facilities as bars and restaurants, modern hotels and expensive spa salons. You came to Authorities to get the permission to build up the Island. They were ready to give you that but with the only one condition. They told you about the locals, who live in the nothern part of the Island and who strongly believed that the Island belonged to them. You were allowed to build anything there after having collected agreement from each aboriginal. The Veeland Secretary of Housing and Urban Development came along with you. He is to make a final dicision about the Island - if it'll stay a wild place where aboriginals live or it'll be a touristic area all over the place. In that case local people will be moved from the territory to the "Big Land".

  • You need to persuade the locals to leave the Island.
  • You need to show to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development that it's a good idea to build up the Island.
  • You need to collect all the tourists votes "for" and "against" (to have more proves that people would like to travel here)

So you came to the Island along with a group of people today in the morning, pretending to be just a usual tourist. The only problem is the locals. On the other side of the Island there is a community of local people. And they don't seem to be ready to move anywhere else. You need to persuade them to leave their homeland.

You know:

1. Noone agreed to take you to the Island. There is just one company which organises trips there, called "The Fings Brothers". So you joined a group of tourists early in the morning and set off for your journey. The way took 45 minutes. The first half of the day you were told legents and stories about the Island by your giude, Noo. The rest of the day you were given free time to swim and soak up the sun, lying on the beach.

2. You didn't want to go back so soon, so you gave money to a boatman, asking him arrive 4 hours later then he must have to. You thought this time would be enough for you to deal with the locals. But later in the evening the boatman didn't arrive at all. Some time later, when you were exploring the area, you found him near a waterfall with a knife in his back. You got scared of it and rushed to the group to tell them what you saw. But when you all together came back there was no body near the same waterfall. Not even a trace.

Your goals:

1. Persuade the locals to leave the Island.

2. Own the Island (you need all the local people to sign a paper)

3. To understand better what aboriginals need, find a person who can tell you more about their culture so that you could offer them something.

4. You need to take your medicine every 20 minutes. If you don't do it you have to behave very nervous and agressive every time you miss it. You'll here an alarm every 20 minutes.

5. Find a local healer who can make you a proper medicine. You need to take something which can calm you down like a tranquilizer.
person.personComment: Has a phobia. Against the greens. Seeks for supporters. He will find out about the oracle and have a new goal. Can use Lockee to learn more about local culture. Can use Zalee to get closer to Kee. You're wearing a white T-shirt

person.personDescription: You have a tatoo with a snake.You can change your opinion about voting. Saw that a fisherman had a strange map.

Character: You're very curious about everything around you. You're only 21 and you just graduated from the Oxford Universty. You're intelligent, you like reading fantasy books and literature about history . Less then a week ago you got married so you and your husband went travelling to Veeland on your honeymoon. You wanted to go to an exotic place so you made your husband go there because he at first wanted to travel around the Europe.

Since you arrived to Veeland, you've visited many sight, art galleries, museums. One day you wanted to take your time reading books about Veeland history so you went to the library alone. You borrowed several books and later in the evening you started reading one of them. It was the oldest book you'd ever seen in your life. It told a lot about legends and customs of local people. You got completely carried away by the book. And on its cover you found strange signs which said: ≈ѻ. From those books you learnt about one unsettled Island - Virgin Island; so you had a desire to see it. You also found out from the books that there're local aboriginals, who were still living on the Island. Your learnt something about their culture and legends.

You know:

  1. You also read about pirates. Although nobody has seen them, people from Veeland believe that hey still plough waters around the Virgin Island. Their "emblem" is two letters: JB. They believe they some to he Island to hide their treasures their.
  2. Aboriginals live as a close-knit community. They respect other people, cultures and religions.
  3. If you want to talk to them it's important to show your respect. So everytime you want to talk to one of them, you bow before starting and when you want to end a conversation.
  4. They believe in a very old legend which says something about dark times and prophicy (пророчество)
  5. They have their own language which they use to write, you picked up some letters from the books:
      • ° - r
      • ﬩ - d
      • ▬ - t
      • » - n
    1. You husband has a skape-shaped tatoo.

      2. You're really scared of all the situation but you also desire to learn more about this place. It seems to you that the Island keeps lots of secrets and you want to write a book about it.

    You couldn't believe you eyes. You found something trully rare! You wanted to know what the signs ≈ѻ meant. You carried looking through other books and found out that these are letters from a forgotten alphabet, which people used to write with. The only people who still use it are those, who live on a so-called Virgin Island, 45 minutes by a boat from the main Land. You got so excited about meeting that people and learn more about their stories and legends that you found an excursion on the Net, provided by "The Frings Brothers" company. It was one-day tour to the Virgin Island. So you told your husband about your desire to go there and the next day you're already here, on the land named Virgin Island.

    To write a book she need to find out:

    1. The whole alphabet.
    2. Local names for 1. "The Virgin Island". 2. "The Volcano" 3. "Dragon cave" 4. "Green Cave" 5. "Wild Waterfall"
    3. What Kaleb is. Find out the legend of it.
    4. Who is Agatha? And how is this name connected to the history of the Island?

    Find a person who's interested in stories about hddin treasures and tell him a legend about the pirates.
person.personComment: Feels there's somethig wrong with the Islans. Learned the culture of the locals. Knows couple of phrases and a bit about their customs

person.personDescription:
Character: You're strong and brave man. One of the locals, you, like a real aboriginal, have been living here for all your life. So-called Virgin Island is your homeland. In your language it's called 'Ku Rou", which means "Strong and Powerful". All people on this land live in harmony with nature as a close-knit community. You respect everything around you and live peacefully on the northen part of the Ku Rou. You're a leader and protector of the commune, who knows a lot about the Island, legends of this place and customs of your people.

You know:

There were no tourists coming to this place until recently. A year ago a man named Noo Fing came to talk to you. He asked to give him a permission to organise trips for tourists to the Ku Rou. You have a very long talk and the results were shocking for all the commune. You agreed. But you set the "rules" that it would be important to follow:

  • Noo is allowed to show tourists only the southern part of the Island.
  • They arrive early in the morning and leave before it gets dark. They never spend night here.
  • Noo doesn't tell tourists about aboriginal's village. He tells them only about animals, plants, fishes and climate.
  • If he breaks any of the rules, he'll never come back to the Ko Rou again.
  1. Certainly, you were against that idea! You strongly believe that this Island belongs to noone but people who've been living here for generations. But you had to agree. Because one day many years ago your dad was saved by a fisherman. You dad used to tell you this story every night to teach you to be greatful. You father, Ziee, was so greatful that he invited the fisherman to his village (once in a history!), told him about the Ko Rou and shared a meal with him. You dad promised the fisherman that he and any member of his family would always remember that he saved his life. And they would help him or his children with anything. Your father gave the fisherman a map so that he could come back to the Island any time he wants. The day Noo came to the Ko Rou, you knew it was his son. You couldn't turn your back on him so you gave him what he needed.
  2. Every time tourists come you watch them closely from behind the trees to make sure they don't go where they mustn't.
  3. Today something happened and Noo broke his promise. People didn't leave the Ku Rou the time they had to. You got really furious!! The minute you found that out you knew - you would never trust Noo again! So you gathered you people and you all set off for the southern part of the Ku Rou to find out what happened.
  4. You believe that Kaleb* Killed the boatman.
  5. You don't share information about your language with outlanders. They don't have to know it. if they ask you to help. You say: "Sorry, it's not possible".
  6. There're things which are marked as "valuables" for you. They may be any plants, jewellery or anything else. You can exchange those things to anything else which is less valuable for you with other people. If somene asks you for a favour, then you can do it in return for one "valuable".
  7. You have a rod of your power. As long as it belongs to you, you're the leader of this commune. Be careful! Someone may try to steal it!

LEGENDS OF KU ROU:

  1. There are lots of local legends about Ku Rou. In the heart of this place there is a sleeping volcano - Chee U (which means "Wild Wind") and you bring it offerings every 5th night of each month to make it remain its sleep. TODAY IS THE NIGHT. You believe if you stop doing it, it'll awake and swallow everything on its way. '
  2. You believe in an old and known prophecy (пророчество) which says that one day an evil Serpent (змий) will come to you Land. It'll come from the sounth and will bring Dark Times along with it. It'll awake a monster that has been sleeping for years and the monster will swallow everything on its way. There's just one thing that can prevent this from happening. It's a heart-shaped diamond, hidden somewhere deep in caves. But only the marked one can touch it. If not the right person does it, he will be cursed forever. If the marked one reveals himself, he'll bring peace to the Ko Rou. The prophecy is believed to come true when someone brings emerald ring to the Ko Rou.
  3. You live in harmony with nature, animals and people. It's very important for local people to keep peace with others.
  4. Numbers 1 and 6 brings bad luck according to your believes as well as emerald and gold.
  5. Legends say that there was once a man, who lived on this Land. He was very powerful and he had a choice how to use his powers. Unfortunately, instead of helping other people and living in harmony with nature, he choosed gold and jewels. He became greedy and agressive. He formed an army and used to attack boats and ships, stealing gold and treasures from them. He hid then all stolen somewhere in the Island. One day it was agreed to expel that man from the Ko Rou to make it peaceful land again. But the man dissapeared and noone has yet seen him. Some people believe that there's his ghost left on the Ko Rou. He protects his treasures and still atack boats and ships which approach closer to the Island. You call his gost *"Kaleb" (which means emerald) because he believed to wear a huge ring with an emerald.

    LOCAL CUSTOMS:

    • It's rude to start and finish a conversation without a bow. If people don't do it you don't talk to them. You say "We don't wanna talk to outlanders".
    • You have your own language which you use to write (noone else can understand it):

        ∩ - a

        ѻ - b

        … - c

        ﬩ - d

        ײַ - e

        ^ - f

        ╝ - g

        ‼ - h

        ▀ - i

        ≈ - j

        ▫ - k

        Ⱡ - l

        § - m

        » - n

        ᴈ - o

        ‖ - p

        ў - q

        ° - r

        s - s

        ▬ - t

        ¦ - u

        ╗ - v

        ⃰ⱡ - w

        ▌- x

        ◄ - y

        ? - z

        Your goals:

      1. You got so furious that Noo broke his promise and now you want to take the map his father gave him back so that he'll never return to the Ko Rou.
      2. Find out who "the Serpent" is and how to stop the prophency from coming true.
      4. You can change your mind about tourists. If you someone gives you something valuable (marked 10!) you'll give your voice 'For" but with a condition that they'll still be on the southern part of the Ko Rou and your people will stay in the northen part.
      5. Buy off Ryan. Understand what he needs.
      6. Find hear-shaped diamond until someone else does it. There is said to be an old map, leading to it. Find it. Share everything you know with your people. The'll help you looking for anything. Use their help. You need to work as one. You support each other. Try to cooperate.
      7. Find all the fragments of the map.
      8. Gather offerings for Chee U.
      9. Make sure that each aboriginal gathered offerings (at least two each)
person.personComment: The leader of locals. Can use person 9

person.personDescription:
Character: You're very kind woman. One of the locals, you, like a real aboriginal, have been living here for all your life. So-called Virgin Island is your homeland. In your language it's called 'Ku Rou", which means "Strong and Powerful". All people on this land live in harmony with nature as a close-knit community. You respect everything around you and live peacefully on the northen part of the Ku Rou. You're a local healer, who knows a lot about healing power of flowers, plants, fruits and mushrooms.

You know:

There were no tourists coming to this place until recently. A year ago a man named Noo Fing came to talk to Kee, a leader and protector of your commune. He asked to give him a permission to organise trips for tourists to the Ku Rou. They had a very long talk and the results were shocking for all the commune. Kee agreed. But he set the "rules" that it would be important to follow:

  • Noo is allowed to show tourists only the southern part of the Island.
  • They arrive early in the morning and leave before it gets dark. They never spend night here.
  • Noo doesn't tell tourists about aboriginal's village. He tells them only about animals, plants, fishes and climate.
  • If he breaks any of the rules, he'll never come back to the Ko Rou again.
  1. You've heard that Kee had reasons to allow a stranger like Noo to organise trips to the Ku Rou. You he owed him a favour.
  2. Today something happened and Noo broke his promise. People didn't leave the Ku Rou the time they had to. So Kee gathered his people and you all set off for the southern part of the Ku Rou to find out what happened.
  3. No matter what will happen, you want to keep peace with tourists, because you trust and respect every person wherever they come from.
  4. You believe that Kaleb* Killed the boatman.
  5. You don't share information about your kanguage with outlanders. They don't have to know it. if they ask you to help. You say: "Sorry, it's not possible".
  6. There're things which are marked as "valuables" for you. They may be any plants, jewellery or anything else. You can exchange those things to anything else which is less valuable for you with other people. If somene asks you for a favour, then you can do it in return for one "valuable".
  7. When you were gathering mushrooms and berries, you found a strange piece of a map in the forest. Tell your leader, Kee, about it.

LEGENDS OF KU ROU:

  1. There are lots of local legends about Ku Rou. In the heart of this place there is a sleeping volcano - Chee U (which means "Wild Wind") and you bring it offerings every 5th night of each month to make it remain its sleep. TODAY IS THE NIGHT. You believe if you stop doing it, it'll awake and swallow everything on its way. '
  2. You believe in an old and known prophecy (пророчество) which says that one day an evil Serpent (змий) will come to you Land. It'll come from the sounth and will bring Dark Times along with it. It'll awake a monster that has been sleeping for years and the monster will swallow everything on its way. There's just one thing that can prevent this from happening. It's a heart-shaped diamond, hidden somewhere deep in caves. But only the marked one can touch it. If not the right person does it, he will be cursed forever. If the marked one reveals himself, he'll bring peace to the Ko Rou. The prophecy is believed to come true when someone brings emerald ring to the Ko Rou.
  3. You live in harmony with nature, animals and people. It's very important for local people to keep peace with others.
  4. Numbers 1 and 6 brings bad luck according to your believes as well as emerald and gold.
  5. Legends say that there was once a man, who lived on this Land. He was very powerful and he had a choice how to use his powers. Unfortunately, instead of helping other people and living in harmony with nature, he choosed gold and jewels. He became greedy and agressive. He formed an army and used to attack boats and ships, stealing gold and treasures from them. He hid then all stolen somewhere in the Island. One day it was agreed to expel that man from the Ko Rou to make it peaceful land again. But the man dissapeared and noone has yet seen him. Some people believe that there's his ghost left on the Ko Rou. He protects his treasures and still atack boats and ships which approach closer to the Island. You call his gost *"Kaleb" (which means emerald) because he believed to wear a huge ring with an emerald.

LOCAL CUSTOMS:

  1. It's rude to start and finish a conversation without a bow. If people don't do it you don't talk to them. You say "We don't wanna talk to outlanders".
  2. You have your own language which you use to write (noone else can understand it):

      ∩ - a

      ѻ - b

      … - c

      ﬩ - d

      ײַ - e

      ^ - f

      ╝ - g

      ‼ - h

      ▀ - i

      ≈ - j

      ▫ - k

      Ⱡ - l

      § - m

      » - n

      ᴈ - o

      ‖ - p

      ў - q

      ° - r

      s - s

      ▬ - t

      ¦ - u

      ╗ - v

      ⃰ⱡ - w

      ▌- x

      ◄ - y

      ? - z

      YOU DO NOT SHARE THIS KNOWLEDGE WITH OUTLANDERS! They don't have to know this.

    1. Your knowledge about healing power of plants:

    • creeping thyme - tranquilizer, to calm down and stop panick atacks
    • Tea made of leaves of origanum - "Sleeping potion"
    • sarcocolla - cure for food poisoning
    • Antidote. If a snake or a spider bit you.
person.personComment: Wants to keep peace with locals. Help everyone to understand local custom. Doesn't know what Kee is up to.

person.personDescription:
Character: You're very sociable person who likes talking about anything with people. Since you work as a guide, your job is to talk; so you're always ready to share your knowledge with others. You were born in Veeland, in a small village named Poui Pi (which means Freedom), As a child you used to help your father catch fish but then you realised that you wanted more then that. There've always been lots of tourists coming each year to Veeland especially in summer (where there were no rains) and you had an idea to organise excursions to interesting and historical places for travellers. You've got a younger brother (Own Fing), so you together decided to move to a bigger city and start your business. You opened a small company, named " The Fings Brothers" and got down to work. It wasn't easy to attract people because it was rather competitive business. So you wanted to offer something unique. Then you had an idea which was going to change everything. There is an Island, 45 minutes by boat from the main land, which is called Ko Rou (which means "Strong and Powerful'). This Island is known for tourists as A Virgin Island, because civilization didn't touch it at all and it is trully a wild and virgin place, full of secrets and spectacular sceneries. There're lots of legends about that place and local people know that there isn't a good idea to travel there. The reason is that a commune of aboriginals, who have been living there for generations, occupies the northen part of the Ko Rou. They think that the Island belongs to them. hey have very strong believes and they don't like outlanders. People who live in Veeland are aware of that. They respect each other's customs and religion. They don't go to the "Virgin Island". They think it's cursed. And they believe that aboriginals from Ko Rou can curse people they don't like.

However, you know Kee (a leader of that commune). One day many years ago your father was fishing somewhere in the ocean. He saw a man who was floating face down on the surface of the water. He thought the man was dead but still he pulled him out. He gave him the first aid and the man turned out to be alive. He was so greatful that he invited your father to come to their village (first in a history!) Your father spent the whole day there, he shared their meal and listened to their stories. By the end of a day, the man (whose name was Ziee) told your dad that further generations will always remember that you dad saved his life and he gave him a map to the Ko Rou so that he could come back any day he wanted. (your dad then gave you the map) He said that they would help him or any member of his family anytime. Ziee was the leader of the commune that time and Kee, his son took his place.

Having that in mind, you came to the Ko Rou a year ago. You asked Kee's permission to bring tourists to the Island. He agreed because he knew the story about your fathers. But he asked to follow some rules.

  1. You're allowed to show tourists only the southern part of the Island.
  2. They arrive early in the morning and leave before it gets dark. They never spend night here.
  3. You don't tell tourists about their village. You tell them only about animals, plants, fishes and climate.
  4. If you break any of the rules, you'll never come back to the Ko Rou again.

You know:

  1. You've always had a dream to make the Ko Rou a touristic Island to make money of it. You've been planning it with your brother ever since you started taking tourists here. You want to "own" the island. But the only problem is aboroginals. As long as they stay here, you can't do anything, because they'll do everything to protect their homeland from intruders, be sure. Also you need to find money to start your business here.
  2. Kee gave your a map to know how to get to the Island.
  3. Today everything was just ususal but your brother didn't show up to collect all from the Island. He's never been late before.
  4. Your brother gave you a strange scroll few wekks ago. He asked you to open it if only something bad happens to him.
  5. When your brother took the group to Ko Rou today, he told you not to show them "Dragon Waterfall". He also said a strange phrase which was "Watch the man in a white T-shirt closely."
  6. The waterfall near which, according to Ryan, the body was found is the Dragon Waterfall.
  7. You know that it very rude to start and finish conversation with locals without showing you respect. If you want to talk to them, you should bow before starting a dialogue and when you want to end it.
  8. Your dad told you a lot about Ko Rou. So you know many local Legends and superstitions. You don't quite believe in them; but you know that locals do.

LEGENDS:

  • There's a sleeping Volcano on a top of the Ko Rou, called Chee U (which means "Wild Wind") Aboriginals believe that if they don't bring it offerings every 5th night of the each month it'll awake. TODAY IS THE NIGHT.
  • 'They believe in an old and known prophecy (пророчество) which says that one day an evil Serpent (змий) will come to their Land. It'll come from the sounth and will bring Dark Times along with it. It'll awake a monster that has been sleeping for years and the monster will swallow everything on its way. There's just one thing that can prevent this from happening. It's a heart-shaped diamond, hidden somewhere deep in caves. But only the marked one can touch it. If not the right person does it, he will be cursed forever. You don't believe in it. Moreover, you think that there is no diamond at all. Who believes in fairy tales anyway?
  • They have their own language which they use to write (noone else can understand it) Your father taught you several things. You remember some letters from it:

    ∩ - a

    ⱡ - w

    ▬ - t

    ╗ - v

      PLACES YOU SHOW PEOPLE ON THE ISLAND:

    • Dragon waterfall - beautiful place which, according to old legents, is the place where the last living dragon died. If you look from afar, you'll notice it's dragon-shaped.
    • Wild waterfall - beatiful waterfall on the southern part of the Island. With strange signs ≈ѻ on the rocks. No legends about this place.
    • Green cave - (near the dragon waterfall) the cave which can hardly be noticed due to its location. If you don't know about the cave you're not likely to find it cause it's hidden in a thick forest. According to legends a stranger who is kind-hearted and has pure intentions will always find this place.
    • Emerald cave - (cave near the wild waterfall) according to legends emerald brings bad luck. This cave is said to be dangerous so local people gave it that name.

      Your goals:
    1. Find out what happened to you brother.
    2. Find the murderer.
    3. Don't give a map which leads the way to the Island to anyone.
    4. You want to make your dream come true especially after what happened to your brother. Make aboriginals leave the Island.
    5. Find a rich patron and make an Island a touristic place.

localYou don't share information about your language with outlanders. They don't have to know it. if they ask you to help. You say: "Sorry, it's not possible". There're things which are marked as "valuables" for you. They may be any plants, jewellery or anything else. You can exchange those things to anything else which is less valuable for you with other people. If somene asks you for a favour, then you can do it in return for one "valuable".

You want to be a leader of your commune. You want to topple (Свергнуть) Kee. To do this you need to steal his "rod of power". First, you need to find out where he keeps it then you need to find a way to steal it.
person.personComment: A betrayer. Mistakenly trust the blues

person.personDescription: <html>You saw some people on the Island through your binocular. They had a sigh JB on their flag. They went to a forest.</html>
Sae people on the Island witha sign JB
person.personComment: mistakenly trust the leader. Very nosy. Wants to know more about local culture

person.personDescription:
Character: You're one of the aboriginals and like they all you've been living on this Island since you were born. All men in your family were fishermen so are you.

You want to get away from the island because you've seen many thing here and you believe it isn't save. You want prophecy to come true to make all leave the Island.

You don't share information about your language with outlanders. They don't have to know it. if they ask you to help. You say: "Sorry, it's not possible".There're things which are marked as "valuables" for you. They may be any plants, jewellery or anything else. You can exchange those things to anything else which is less valuable for you with other people. If somene asks you for a favour, then you can do it in return for one "valuable".

You don't want to support the leader of your commune, Kee. You want money and gold and you want to leave the Island for the Big Land. But you don't think Kee will let you go. You need to help an American businessman to make the Island a touristis place so that they'll make all locals leave the place.

  1. You've seen the boatman coming into the forbidden cave.
  2. You saw his body. You stole a piece of map from his pocket and a dagger which stuck in his back. (with a sing JB on it)
  3. You know about pirates, they pay you money to keep silent because they didn't know anybody else to know about their treasures. they still cone to the Ko Rou and hide their treasures somewhere in the caves.
person.personComment: Against the green. Spy. Wants to earn money.

person.personDescription:
Character: You're nice and open-minded person from Spain. You adore travelling, exploring the world, visiting museums and art-galleries. You like travelling on your own, that's how you got used to living. You feel that you're free and you trully enjoy it.

You used to be an archeologist but now you work as a jeweller expert in Spain for a big international company. You travel a lot to "hunt" for exotic and rare jewellery. Last month you decided to explore a new country, named Veeland. You were sure you could find there something interesting and unique due to their its history. So you booked a two-week trip on the Net and set off for you journey. Having spent a week there, you saw an offer to go on a one-day excursion to the "Virgin Island" which was said to keep secrets of the past, including hidden treasures and ghosts of their former owners. You got carried away by the idea of exploring such an exotic place so you joined a group of tourists today early in the morning and arrived to the place of destination.

During the day a guide told you some legends about the area, showed you a cave, "The Green" Waterfall and the wild animals, which lived within tropical forest. The rest of the day you must have spent swimming in the sea, snorkiling and lying on a deserted beach. But you desided against it. Despite tha fact that you weren't allowed to explore the Island alone, you were able to escape from the watchful guide's eye and walked around a bit. When you were walking around you noticed a man, who was watching the tourists closely, hiding behind the trees. He looked like an aboriginal and you were very surprised to see him coz you didn't expect that "Virgin" place to be inhabited by anyone. After walking for about 15 minutes more you saw strange signs on the sand. You thought it was kind of a message and you took a photo of it.

You know:

  1. You saw a man behind the trees who was watching the tourists.
  2. You can tell if the stone is precious or not by just one look at it. You have a hand-glass and there is a special sign, which shows if the stone is precious ot it's a fake.
  3. There're things which are marked as "valuables" for you. They may be jewellery or precious stones. You can exchange those things to anything else which is less valuable for you with other people. If somene asks you for a favour, then you can do it in return for one "valuable".

You're hunting for precious things. Collect 5 valuables during the game (special sign with a grade of value)

A Goal during a game:

Find a heart-shaped diamond
person.personComment: a jeweller. Has seen lots of strange things. Receives love letters

person.personDescription:
Character: You're local sorceress (шаманка). You live on this land and your fathers did. You love the Island, it's your home and you'll do anything to protect it. You call it "Ko Rou" which in your language means "Strong and powerful". You're also very unsual person, since you can tell fortunes, people's future and past. You use sea shells for this.

There're things which are marked as "valuables" for you. They may be any plants, jewellery or anything else. You can exchange those things to anything else which is less valuable for you with other people. If somene asks you for a favour, then you can do it in return for one "valuable".

You know:

  1. You sometimes have visions and you write messages on the sand for your brothers and sisters (that's how you call your contrymen)
  2. You foud a strange piece of map near one of the caves. Tell your leader, Kee, about it.
  3. Kee is the leader of your commune. Lockee is a local healer. Ulee is a fisherman.
  4. You can tell fortunes for other people. One person can ask you to do that once in a 15 minutes. If they do it more often, you say: Clouds gathered and I cannot see anything. Come another time.
  • If Kee asks you to read his fortune, you'll say: 1. (first time he asks) - "You have a betrayer. Be aware!" 2. (second time he asks) - The betrayer likes gold. 3. (third time he asks) - The betrayer has something that you need to find what you're looking for. (4th time and all futher times he asks) - Clouds gathered and I cannot see anything. Come another time.
  • If Ryan asks you to read his fortune, you say that you'll do that if he brings you something valuable (marked not less then 2). If he does you'll say: 1. (first time he asks) - "The Serpent has already come". 2. (second time he asks) - "Give Kee what he's looking for". 3. (third time and all futher times he asks) - Clouds gathered and I cannot see anything. Come another time.
  • If Noo asks you to read his fortune, you'll say: 1. (first time he asks) - "Your brother was killed by a very strong and dangerous man" 2. (second time he asks) - "Be careful. Very careful. The man that looks like your brother isn't him" . 3 (third time he asks and all futher times) - "Kaleb. Do you know what it means? Find out." Give him card 3.
  • If Priscills asks you to read her fortune, you'll say: 1. (first time she asks) - "Agatha didn't tell you the truth about the ring you're wearing". Give her card 1. 2. (second time she asks) - "Kaleb left you a map. I see rocks with signs and fragments of the map". It's all you see for her. Futher tomes you say: "Clouds gathered and I cannot see anything. Come another time."

LEGENDS OF KU ROU:

  1. There are lots of local legends about Ku Rou. In the heart of this place there is a sleeping volcano - Chee U (which means "Wild Wind") and you bring it offerings every 5th night of each month to make it remain its sleep. TODAY IS THE NIGHT. You believe if you stop doing it, it'll awake and swallow everything on its way. '
  2. You believe in an old and known prophecy (пророчество) which says that one day an evil Serpent (змий) will come to you Land. It'll come from the sounth and will bring Dark Times along with it. It'll awake a monster that has been sleeping for years and the monster will swallow everything on its way. There's just one thing that can prevent this from happening. It's a heart-shaped diamond, hidden somewhere deep in caves. But only the marked one can touch it. If not the right person does it, he will be cursed forever. If the marked one reveals himself, he'jj bring peace to the Ko Rou.
  3. You live in harmony with nature, animals and people. It's very important for local people to keep peace with others.
  4. Numbers 1 and 6 brings bad luck according to your believes as well as emerald and gold.
  5. Legends say that there was once a man, who lived on this Land. He was very powerful and he had a choice how to use his powers. Unfortunately, instead of helping other people and living in harmony with nature, he chose gold and jewels. He became greedy and agressive. He formed an army and used it to attack boats and ships, stealing gold and treasures from them. He hid then all stolen somewhere in the Island. One day it was agreed to expel that man from the Ko Rou to make it peaceful land again. But the man dissapeared and noone has yet seen him. Some people believe that there's his ghost left on the Ko Rou. He protects his treasures and still atack boats and ships which approach closer to the Island. You call his gost *"Kaleb" (which means emerald) because he believed to wear a huge ring with an emerald.

LOCAL CUSTOMS:

  1. It's rude to start and finish a conversation without a bow. If people don't do it you don't talk to them. You say "We don't wanna talk to outlanders".
  2. You have your own language which you use to write (noone else can understand it)! You don't share the information about your language with tourists! They don't have to know it.

    ∩ - a

  3. ѻ - b

    … - c

    ﬩ - d

    ײַ - e

    ^ - f

    ╝ - g

    ‼ - h

    ▀ - i

    ≈ - j

    ▫ - k

    Ⱡ - l

    § - m

    » - n

    ᴈ - o

    ‖ - p

    ў - q

    ° - r

    s - s

    ▬ - t

    ¦ - u

    ╗ - v

    ⃰ⱡ - w

    ▌- x

    ◄ - y

    ? - z

  4. Gather offerings.

  5. Make outlanders leav. They bring only bad luck.

A ghost of Kaleb. You possessed a boatman when he was killed by pirates. You came to finish what you started - you left all your treasures to your daughter - Agatha. And you want to get back on the locals who many many years ago expeled you from the Island because you were crual, powerful and liked gold. You have a magiv power to wake the Volcano up. But first you need to find the diamond and give it to your daughter.
